# SKCameraNode

**Class**

A node that determines which parts of the scene are visible within a view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class SKCameraNode
```

```swift
class SKCameraNode
```

## Overview

If you don’t use a camera in your scene, you control the visible portion of a scene using its [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKScene/anchorPoint] property.

## First Steps

- **Getting Started with a Camera**: Learn the semantics of using a camera in your scene.

## Node Visibility

- **containedNodeSet()**: Finds nodes that are visible in the camera’s viewport.
- **contains(_:)**: Checks to see if a node is visible in the camera’s viewport.

## Base Nodes

- **Using Base Nodes to Lay Out SpriteKit Content**: Use nonvisual nodes to define the layout of a scene.
- **SKNode**: The base class of all SpriteKit nodes.
- **SKReferenceNode**: A node that’s defined in an archived `.sks` file.
